metadata.title: CVE-2021-47595 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/sched: sch_ets: don't remove idle classes from the round-robin listShuang reported that the following script: 1) tc qdisc add dev ddd0 handle10: parent 1: ets bands 8 strict 4 priomap 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 72) mausezahn ddd0 -A 10.10.10.1 -B 10.10.10.2 -c 0 -a own -b00:c1:a0:c1:a0:00 -t udp & 3) tc qdisc change dev ddd0 handle 10: ets bands4 strict 2 quanta 2500 2500 priomap 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 crashessystematically when line 2) is commented: list_del corruption,ffff8e028404bd30->next is LIST_POISON1 (dead000000000100) ------------[ cuthere ]------------ kernel BUG at lib/list_debug.c:47! invalid opcode: 0000[#1] PREEMPT SMP NOPTI CPU: 0 PID: 954 Comm: tc Not tainted 5.16.0-rc4+#478 Hardware name: Red Hat KVM, BIOS 1.11.1-4.module+el8.1.0+4066+0f1aadab04/01/2014 RIP: 0010:__list_del_entry_valid.cold.1+0x12/0x47 Code: fe ff 0f0b 48 89 c1 4c 89 c6 48 c7 c7 08 42 1b 87 e8 1d c5 fe ff 0f 0b 48 89 fe 4889 c2 48 c7 c7 98 42 1b 87 e8 09 c5 fe ff <0f> 0b 48 c7 c7 48 43 1b 87 e8fb c4 fe ff 0f 0b 48 89 f2 48 89 fe RSP: 0018:ffffae46807a3888 EFLAGS:00010246 RAX: 000000000000004e RBX: 0000000000000007 netlink_rcv_skb+0x50/0x100netlink_unicast+0x1a5/0x280 netlink_sendmsg+0x257/0x4d0sock_sendmsg+0x5b/0x60 ____sys_sendmsg+0x1f2/0x260 ___sys_sendmsg+0x7c/0xc0__sys_sendmsg+0x57/0xa0 RCX: 00007efdc8031338 RDX: 0000000000000000 RSI:00007ffdf1ce9890 RDI: 0000000000000003 RBP: 0000000000000000 R08:0000000000000001 R09: 000000000078a940 R10: 000000000000000c R11:0000000000000246 R12:     Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47595` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
